title: Pakistan Junior Cadet Corps Act, 1953
description: Official consolidated text of Pakistan Junior Cadet Corps Act, 1953 (XXXVI of 1953) published by The Pakistan Code (Military Laws).

provisions.title: Section 1. Short title, extent and commencement
provisions.content:
_ (1) This Act may be called the Pakistan Junior
Cadet Corps Act, 1953.
(2) It applies to the whole of Pakistan.
(3) It shall come into force at once.

provisions.title: Section 2. Definitions. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,
provisions.content:
_
(a)        “cadet” means a school boy who is deemed to be enrolled as a cadet under
sub-section (1) of section 5 ;
1
(b)             [*    *                     *                    *                     *                *      *]
(c)        “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Act.

provisions.title: Section 3. Constitution of Junior Cadet Corps. There shall be raised and maintained in the manner
provisions.content:
hereinafter provided a force, which shall be designated the Junior Cadet Corps, and shall consist of
units constituted under section 4.

provisions.title: Section 4. Constitution and organization of units
provisions.content:
_(1) Subject to the control of the 2[Federal
Government], the 1[Chief of the Army Staff] may, by order in writing, direct the constitution and
maintenance for any boys’ school in Pakistan of two separate companies of the Junior Cadet Corps,
each company to consist of the boys of one of each of the two final classes of the school, and may
direct the disbandment of the companies so constituted.
(2) The companies constituted under sub-section (1) from schools located in the same
revenue district shall jointly constitute a battalion to be designated after the name of that district.

provisions.title: Section 5. Certain students to be deemed to be enrolled
provisions.content:
_(1) On the constitution of a company
under sub-section (1) of section 4, every student of the class concerned who,___

(i)        is above thirteen years of age, at the commencement of the academic year, or
by the first day of April of that year, and
(ii)       is certified on examination by an officer of the Pakistan Army Medical Corps
to be physically fit to undergo the prescribed military training, shall be
deemed to have been enrolled as a cadet in that company.
(2) A student who is deemed to be enrolled as a cadet in a company under sub-section (1)
shall not cease to belong to that company, until he passes out of or otherwise leaves, the class for
which the company was constituted, or is duly certified by an officer of the Pakistan Army Medical
Corps to have become physically unfit to undergo further military training.

provisions.title: Section 6. Officers of the Junior Cadet Corps
provisions.content:
_(1) The 1[Federal Government], on the
recommendation of the Headmaster of the school for which units of the Junior Cadet Corps have
been constituted under sub-section (1) of section 4, supported by the Director of Public Instruction of
the Province concerned and the officer commanding the local military formation being not below the
rank of brigadier, may appoint any member of the staff of that school, who is not less than twenty-
three and not more than thirty-five years of age, as an officer of the corps.
(2) A person appointed officer under sub-section (1) shall be granted a commission in the
form prescribed in this behalf under sub-section (2) of section 232 of the Government of India Act,
1935 3[or under clause (2) of Article 40 of the Constitution] 4[of 1956 or under clause (2) of Article
17 of the Constitution of 1962] 2[or under clause (2) of Article 56 of the Interim Constitution of 1972
or under clause (2) of Article 243 of the Constitution of 1973].

provisions.title: Section 7. Officers to be attached to regular units for training. An officer of the Junior Cadet
provisions.content:
Corps shall be liable, under the orders of the officer commanding the local military formation being
not below the rank of brigadier, to be attached to a unit of the regular army for undergoing the
military training prescribed for his class.

provisions.title: Section 8. Officers to be subject to military law. An officer of the Junior Cadet Corps shall, when
provisions.content:
undergoing military training under section 7, be subject to 5[* * *] the Pakistan Army Act, 1952
(XXXIX of 1952),] in such manner and to such extent as may be prescribed.

provisions.title: Section 9. Allowance of officers
provisions.content:
_An officer of the Junior Cadet Corps may be paid such allowance
by the Provincial Government concerned as may have been agreed upon between the 1[Federal
Government] and the Provincial Government:
Provided that an officer, who is attached to a regular unit for training under section 7, shall
receive such additional allowances as may be prescribed.

provisions.title: Section 10. Termination of officer’s commissions
provisions.content:
_ (1) The 1[Federal Government] may withdraw
the commission of an officer at any time and for any cause whatever.

(2) An officer of the Junior Cadet Corps shall cease to hold his commission___
(i)        on ceasing to be a member of the staff of the school from which he received
his commission:
Provided that an officer who is immediately re-employed in another school for which
companies of the Junior Cadet Corps have been constituted under subsection (1) of
section 4 may, on the recommendation of the Headmaster of that school, be allowed
by the 1[Chief of the Army Staff] to retain his commission ;
(ii)       on attaining the age of forty-five years.

provisions.title: Section 11. Military training of cadets
provisions.content:
_A cadet shall be liable to undergo the prescribed military
training.

provisions.title: Section 12. Discipline of Cadets
provisions.content:
_(1) The Headmaster of each school shall be Honorary
commanding officer of the companies constituted for his school under sub-section (1) of section 4
and the primary responsibility for enforcing discipline in those companies shall rest on him.
(2) With the approval of the 1[Chief of the Army staff] the Headmaster of each school may
frame rules for the punishment of cadets who wilfully and without reasonable cause absent them-
selves from parades held for imparting the prescribed military training or who are otherwise guilty of
conduct to the prejudice of good order and discipline in the Junior Cadet Corps.
(3) In addition to any other punishment, which the Headmaster may specify therein, the rules
made under sub-section (2) shall provide for the subjection of the offender to extra drill for twenty
minutes.

provisions.title: Section 13. Members of Junior Cadet Corps not to be liable to perform service
provisions.content:
_Officers and
cadets of the Junior Cadet Corps shall not be liable to perform military service of any kind whatever.

provisions.title: Section 14. Power to make rules. The 1[Chief of the Army Staff] may, with the approval of the
provisions.content:
2
[Federal Government], make rules to provide for any matter which may be prescribed under this Act
and to carry out the purposes of this Act.
